# Inaba Manyō Historical Museum

| opened_date         = 30 October 1994
| inauguration_date   =

opened in Tottori, Tottori Prefecture, Japan in 1994. Poet and presumed ''Man'yōshū'' compiler Ōtomo no Yakamochi was appointed Governor of Inaba Province, now the eastern half of the prefecture of Tottori, in 758 and composed the latest-dated and final poem in the anthology the following New Year's Day; the museum is located close to the site of the ancient Inaba Provincial Capital. The permanent exhibition, featuring replicas as well as historic materials, has displays relating to Ōtomo no Yakamochi and the poets of the ''Man'yōshū; Man'yō'' culture, including dyeing and weaving, music and dance, and cuisine; Inaba Province, Inaba Kokubun-ji, and Kajiyama Kofun; Ifukibe no Tokotari-hime; and the local . There is also a  with fifty different plants that feature in the anthology.
See also
